cs.LO, cs.FL, cs.PL, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with an extension of Linear Temporal Logic (LTL) to describe cost functions, which is a topic related to logic and formal languages (cs.LO). The paper also discusses the translation of this new logic to cost automata, which is a topic related to formal languages and automata theory (cs.FL). Additionally, the paper mentions the decidability of decision problems for this logic, which is a topic related to complexity theory (cs.PL). The paper also introduces a new syntactic congruence for cost functions, which is a topic related to algebra and mathematical logic (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the expressive power of the logic, which is a topic related to machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.LG).
